intro: Ouratea pycnanthos, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences and showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in the dry season. The plant has glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental species. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and visually striking plant in tropical landscapes.
